These are choices for an American version of a live action DBZ movie. So 
complaining about the race of these choices is rather silly. Yes I 
understand DBZ, is a Japanese product, and everybody would want it to be an 
all Japanese cast out of respect. But let's face it if it's an American 
version, it's not gonna happen. If Japan decided to do Marvel or DC movies 
do you actually think the cast is gonna be anything but a Japanese cast? 
NO! So you can't expect any less from an Americanized version. As long as 
the movie is good, the race of the cast choices shouldn't even be an issue. 
I'm aware Dragonball Evolution sucked, but that doesn't mean America isn't 
compilable of making a good Dragonball film. With a good cast, good script 
and director that gives a damn, it could be solid film, that people will 
talk about for ages. So let's put a stop to this race and which country 
should or shouldn't do it crap, because it's just plain silly. Oh and 
apologies for my bad typing here, but I'm sure everyone get's my point 
anyways lol.﻿

+jrdn DROPKICK While a lot of what you say makes sense I do have to 
disagree somewhat with your view on typecasting Sayans. The thing with them 
is that they intentionally looked like humans by the original writer's 
stand point. The only real outward difference is the tail and they turn 
into a Ozaru when they are exposed to moonlight. The appearance was 
intentionally uncanny. Now where race is applicable to a Sayan. Depending 
on which DB you go by there were Black Sayans hiding in the background of 
the crowd scenes. Vegita, his father, and Kakkarat all were portrayed to be 
vaguely something like a cross between what you get when you mix a Chinese 
person with a Japanese person. Mr. Popo was a big fat black genie. Even 
Napa looked more like a cross between a Japanese guy and Mr. Clean.

Now you mentioned two names that should stay away from this if it ever gets 
done as far as directing... allow me to add to that list... Tim Burton... 
he needs to stick to his genera and stop brutalizing fictional characters 
and their stories. Joel Shumacher... Arnold Swartzenegger as Dr. Freeze.... 
Lol. Alejandro González Iñárritu... WORST MOVIE EVER WHEN HE MADE BABEL! I 
WANT MY ******* MONEY BACK YOU SCHMUCK! I also think that if he were smart 
David Lynch should steer clear of this. Too bad Akira Toriama himself could 
not direct a movie effort.

+KingOfAllAnimals THIS IS GENERAL REPLY TO NO EVERY ONE AND ITS GUNNA BE 
ALONG ONE
Asians = from Asia
Caucasians = parts of Europe
Africans = Africa 
Sayians = ALIIEEENNNSSS!!!
there is literally no reason for him to be asian!
If any thing from a writing stand point him being white or black in an 
Asian society or culture makes far more sense as it plays off the themes of 
him being an alien or outsider as goku as a young child and adult often 
faces the fact he is not like any one else that he meets in his travels 
ALLLSSSSOOO let ask ourselves this........,
Can a successful dragon ball z movie be made?
So lets look at story any one who can take off their 90s rose tint glasses 
knows that what dragon ball and z called a story went some thing like this. 
(dragon ball) travel to werid places with think things, get in a fight and 
every 5 or ten episodes find a dragon ball then (dragon ballz) Life was 
good then something attacks, Goku loses every one else fights and also 
loses then new super sayian form and goku wins and they wish every one back 
to life. I AM A FANBOY i love db and dbz but guess what its not about the 
story and thats why every movie has done poorly as they try and take a 
simple story that works just fine that concept being any odds can be over 
come with strength of will and that victory does not mean defeating the 
enemy but defeat yourself and becoming stronger and better person. Up to 
this point film makers have chosen to make it needlessly complex and end up 
being silly and not in the way the anime did so well but in our day of film 
making where the young nerds and geeks of the past our now alot older and 
want to see classics from there youth grom up with them and have complex 
stories, deeper character development and much darker themes and plot 
device. So would north american or European audiences respond well and 
enjoy a simpler plot based more around the structure of the source material 
or would fault for not trying to push the envelope? That question would 
better answered by some one like The game/movie theorist. 
Back to the question I first purposed
Can a successful dragon ball z movie be made?
In my humble opinion 
I say yes
but I believe that they would need have balance of culture making able to 
being seen by asian and non-asian audiences 
also i believe the visual would be the hardest part as it clear anime does 
not translate well in to live action as far a character design goes so 
again then would have to balance being faith to source material and 
redesigns 
The cast would also not need to be to most talented top teir actors but 
just those passionate for the project as it will always shine through just 
look at pretty much the only good thing about dragon ball evolution and 
that was james marsters as piccolo. james loved the role and it showed as 
he came of as sinister badass and rather intelligent (despite the script 
and every other aspect of the move working against him)
This last one will be an unpopular opinion but it NEEEDDSS a director that 
can update and realize that with this kind of movie would needs to be 
heavily a visual experience and not to push the story to far in the the 
needlessly complex a director like ...........MICHEAL FUCKING BAY! Thats 
right! or some like him that can make sure that it was visualy impressive 
like the early transformer movies and not some one like M. Night Shamilan(i 
know i didnt spell it right) who can completely destroy a story that needs 
no changes like in the last airbender
But hey thats just a theory a dragon ball z theory thank for reading
:P you see what I did there lol
and if like this little rant please check out my pokemon theory video on my 
channel called "The genocide of mew"
thank you to any one who made it this far and remember GLHf!!!

+Karl Kuate

who did the Teddy Sevalis (who loves you Babe?). Young Goky looked Asian

I feel pretty confident though you got the idea here.

Also just in case, Mr. Popo should look like a fat genie in black face! Its

Potentially he is the toughest one present short of Mr. Bill (The God of 
Destruction Beerus) and his mentor considering he was the only man to ever 
run the length of Snake Way. Even Goku flew most of the way or slept on a 
taxi and got dumped into hell accidentally.

+KingOfAllAnimals Your point makes sense. However, GOKU white??? noo!! 
Black?? Noo!! Asian, yess!!. Mixed Asian and white, potentially!!.

+KingOfAllAnimals Completely agree with every point you made... If 
Hollywood ever makes a "real" DBZ film, they'll probably make Piccolo 
African American just to have a person of "color" in the flim. lol, shit is 
ridiculous.

+Steven Phillips
For one Goku is a Sayan. He is not human. next is preservation of the 
original flavor of the story. Face it, Mr. Popo is black and he actually 
could be far tougher then Goku but that is only alluded to throughout the 
story.

Next is turning characters that were originally one race into another is 
RACIST AND POLITICALLY CORRECT BULLSHIT!

Sorry but I despise it when people retell a story and utterly change the 
characters especially to suit a politically motivated intention.

Liberals SUCK DONKEY BALLS SHAFT AND ALL! It is not a crime to be white or 
Asian. Also it is tacky to Americanize a story originally written in JAPAN 
OR ANY OTHER NATION FOR THAT MATTER!

How would you like it if I retold the MLK Jr. story and made him Mexican? 
How about I take the story of Harriet Tubman and make her white instead? 
Well, these are figures from history and this bullshit always starts with 
fiction and moves into reality and this is reflecting now in our education 
system too. I feel it is a crime to rewrite history to create lies about 
things that are flattering to a culture. Its like soon it will be a crime 
to be white or to portray anything white. OH HERE IS A GOOD ONE! Let's 
rewrite Shaft and make Shaft Chinese. Then we can take Superfly and make 
him an Autistic Jewish boy.

This is a form if villianizing white people for one. Secondly you change a 
story too much like Fox Entertainment (from now on only to be known as FUX 
UP ENTERTAINMENT) did to the Fantastic Four. They changed the story so much 
it is not the Fantastic Four any more for a ton of reasons.

Really if anything this shows how much Hollywood and other forms of cinema 
are lacking any real story telling talent considering they are having to 
rehash old stories and TV shows instead of coming up with original content. 
The Wild Wild West was absolutely DESTROYED by Hollywood. For one Dr. 
Loveless was a Midget and a megalomaniac. he always made others do his 
dirty work and always had an escape planned. He probably is my most 
favorite bad guy in that he was actually one of the smartest ones and even 
could evade and escape capture as he had done in several episodes of the 
original TV series. Also James West was WHITE, not black... and Ulysses S 
Grant was a total racist and would never talk to a black man as an equal 
and never did. And in that day and age for a black man to mingle in "white 
Culture" so freely....come on, lets face reality here and not romanticize 
things too much, America needs to face its shame rather then hide from it 
because this whole Reinvention of other stories is PLAGIARISM at the least.

Imagine how fucked up it would be to take a Kirosawa classic like The Seven 
Samurai and make them all everything racially other then Japanese men and 
set the story in Okinawa. Absolutely wrong.

Now take Afro Samurai... THAT IS A BAD ASS SHOW. The main character is 
black. It was an original show written and portrayed in comics and its 
movies were true to the manga. While anachronistic in ways it still 
preserved the Samurai flavor, did not alter Samurai culture, and was an 
original and new story all unto itself. Why can't people come up with 
original stories like that if they have to have black characters in them 
rather then fuck someone else's story and change characters because the 
writer really has no original ideas or their own creativity to offer? 
Simple as that.
+KingOfAllAnimals what's wrong with making goku black??

+RealDealSoulja
Being liberally minded is not a sin. Being a Liberal however is. its all in 
the political track record. This goes WAY past the second amendment. 
Political Liberals are the pinnacle of selective ignorance and arrogant 
elitism backed by passive aggressiveness. I myself am a Centrist Moderate 
who believes any law or policy should reflect the global good and global 
protection of all in our nation, not selective laws and politically charged 
policy. Also Liberals are the last person you want balancing your checkbook 
if you catch my drift.

Also in defense of a black presence in movies there was no reason why they 
could not at minimum have had a cameo appearance of one of Marvel's past 
black superheroes. I can think of at least three. Your idea also is very 
sound. There is no reason why a supporting character like a scientist or 
lab tech has to be a minor player.

The director and studio should have left the story to its original arc and 
not lumped Dr. Doom in with the F4. If they had to go there then they 
should have split the story into two parts where the F4 get their powers 
and then DD in his home and begins his reign of terror and finally crosses 
and gets his ass handed to him by the F4 (or did they actually nail the 
real DD since he did hide behind his Doombots a lot).

Nope, they all had to be one big happy dysfunctional family. I would expect 
this drivel from the Modern Disney who more than likely is butchering Star 
Wars.

+KingOfAllAnimals I'm somewhat of a liberal myself, but I agree that any 
capable person (in the U.S. at least) should be able to own a firearm. And 
I didn't like that they changed Johnny Storm's ethnicity just to have black 
people in that particular movie. If they wanted black people in there, they 
could've had some of the lab techs or teachers be African-American. They 
ruined what could've been a great movie.

+RealDealSoulja
Dude, any time you allow "executives" to make creative decisions count on 
the movie being a flop. Executives are not creative usually. Most of the 
time they are control hungry assholes who will throw their weight around at 
the worst possible times. On top of that most movie executives have no 
cinematic talent at all. They are bean counters and middlemen always 
stuffing themselves between concept and end product. they are always the 
same assholes who demand compromise and wind up producing mediocrity if not 
an outright abortion fit only to punish the deserving. And when people 
throw money at this BS they get what they deserve.

My ex GF took me to see the movie Babel. I hated it so much I wanted to 
demand my money back. She loved it however even though it was so overly 
politicized and the message it sent was utterly confusing. It was poorly 
made, the story was scattered over three arcs in the most random fashion 
and the "Guns are bad" message hidden within made me want to steal the film 
reel and burn it to spare others the misery of that steaming pile. Babel is 
what you get when you allow political liberals to make a movie. And sadly 
this crap is happening now with Comic Book storylines being made into 
movies. Tell me Fantastic 4 was not politicized and I will say turning 
white characters into blacks is not?

+KingOfAllAnimals In all honesty I think Fox destroyed this movie. The 
director even blamed the steaming pile of shit this movie was on Fox 
executives, lol.

+RealDealSoulja
You sir are generous. I actually would like to send a letter to Marvel 
telling them how I am glad to not have wasted money on a steaming pile of 
POOP! Sadly their Studio is in Manhattan Beach CA and that is Liberalsville 
south of Liberaltown Santa Monica. Anywhere you have a large population of 
Liberals you have DOOKIE like this stinking up the Silver Screen. And to 
think Hollywood has gone down hill badly lately. movie making in America 
just has taken a backwards slide into mediocrity. It sucks to think another 
Studio would have done much better with it like Warner is doing for DC 
comics. I hated DC but I have to admit Warner Brothers did Batman justice 
with their animated series while most of the movies sucked donkey prong. 
Also they did Justice League seriously good. I did say I had a marked 
disdain for DC? I bet had Warner Brothers done Fantastic 4 it would have 
been kept to the original flavor.

I gave this movie two thumbs down and a 'boo-hiss!'

Two words: HELL NO! First of all, no producer would have the budget to pay 
all of these famous actors at once. It would be a risk to put so many 
famous actors in a movie if they didn't know if it would do well. They 
don't have to be famous. Even a homeless person in the streets of New York 
could be the best lookalike of Goku. Why put your picks inside? Just 
because they're famous and they can act a little bit? Everyone can learn to 
act in a matter of days. It's not hard. Not all movies have all of their 
cast famous actors, and yet they perform excellent. Then again, all your 
picks are awful. The only one i liked was imperfect Cell. And it was CGI. 
My opinion is that if a DB movie is ever to be made, it should be in CGI. 
And as realistic as possible. If you look at Final Fantasy The Spirits 
Within, which was made 15 years ago, imagine what they can do now. You 
wouldn't even be able to tell the difference between CGI and reality.﻿

A DBZ movie is certainly POSSIBLE, but it would take a lot of work.
Sadly, people these days don't like the crazy-ass sci-fi BS that makes 
Dragon Ball so great; so a LOT would have to be toned down. Namely, the 
heroes visiting Namek.

The idea of US going into space just seems so oddly far-fetched in movies 
that aren't Star Trek, and I have no idea why.

But then, in a perfect world, a DBZ movie would be based solely on the 
Saiyan saga, and would probably be followed by a prequel film to explain 
who the hell that sexy green mofo in the turban is. Because I feel if there 
WAS a DBZ movie, Piccolo would be the Groot of it. The big guy that makes 
all teh bitches squee.﻿

+xenomorphelv426
they do have Blond hair only after a burst of Ki. It's more like a change 
of physical characteristics such as how vampires original eyes weren't 
crimson red when they're human. The concept of changing of physical 
characteristic through some power surge is a common thing on Manga. One 
other good example of such concept usage is on the manga Yu Yu Hakushou, 
Kurama hair turned from red to white when he's turns to strong version. 
Goku and Vegeta being an alien support the possibility of physical changes 
when they go to power up version of themselves, aka Super Saiyan.

That to say, if it's about skin, Toriyama doesn't seem to differ white from 
yellow on his manga. If you don't believe it, see master Roshi, Krillin, 
General Blue, General White, and Commander Red...they all have the same 
skin, just different basic natural hair color. Goku and Vegeta also have 
the same skin color as them, which means they can be depicted by both Asian 
and white, but it will be closer to depict them by interracial/mix blood 
actors, since they're none of the earth basic race.

+John Le Yes, it takes place on earth. There is a Japan and a Germany, but 
they are not the same as on our earth. Look at a map of the earth in 
Dragonball Z, it is commonly referred to as Dragon World. It kind of looks 
like a slightly broken up Pangaea which is why I said it does not take 
place on a "typical earth."

Not only do I see a lot of plagiarism of Prometheus (the Namekians) but the 
character casting just doesn't hit me. I have seen other DBZ ideas with 
characters who are much more like the original animation characters in 
appearance on Youtube. While the art is great there is only so far you can 
take liberties with someone else's story before you distort the piss out of 
it. Take the original Star Trek vs. the Remake of the original Star Trek. 
The original Star trek was camp. It was in its day innovative and had this 
cheesy campiness to it that gave it its appeal to some of us Sci-fi 
lovers.But then everything after that was just someone else turning Star 
trek into Palestine/ Israel (DS9), The Love Boat (Next Generation), and 
Lost in Space and a STRONG hint of Space 1999 (Voyager). The movies up to 
1991's Final Frontier all preserved the original flavor and was careful to 
stay true to the story arc. With the 1994 movie release of Star Trek 
Generations it all went completely south from there. With Star trek Next 
Generation and Star Trek Generations the story was changed SO much it lost 
its appeal (at least to me) because of it becoming a preachy hokey bogus 
'feel's good" love your neighbor travesty (Next Generation) and a 
propagandized politicized load of crap (DS9) and worst was when it became a 
disambiguated Lost In Space episode (Voyager).

Honestly if someone is going to retell SOMEONE ELSE'S  story at least have 
the courtesy of doing so with as much of the original flavor as you can 
maintain. That is where a show like Babylon 5 came in. It was not Star Trek 
by any stretch of the imagination. It was completely its own story.

Look, if you want to nitpick my opinion fine. I read the first three books 
of the Dune series. The movie by David Lynch completely screwed the pooch. 
D. Lynch is a GREAT director and capable of some fantastic and graphic 
surrealism BUT this is one time he completely fucked a story up. There were 
many important details to the story he took HUGE liberties with. While not 
EXACT in a lot of respects the Sci Fi Channel's redux was FAR closer to the 
original in many ways (storyline, technologies used by the Fremen, the 
characters ESPECIALLY the Sand Worms!) but the directors of both probably 
had no clue what the hell an Ornithopter is. (An Ornithopter for those of 
you who do not know is a flying machine that flaps its wings like a bird to 
achieve flight. In the Dune books the flying machines used on Arrakis were 
supposed to vaguely look like mechanical eagles. Have to admit that would 
have looked absolutely BAD ASS!)

It is small details that can make ore break a movie concept especially when 
it is going to be a retelling of an animation converted to real life 
action. I know it is not easy to find people who not only look like a 
character (even with creative makeup work and special effects involved) but 
to find someone who sounds and acts like that character just adds to the 
headache. But that is what separates the Master from the Plebian. This just 
does not hit me as something that will even be DBZ by the time it is done.

Yes I would like to see a DBZ live action adaptation but again I am one of 
those people who is detail oriented. Nice concept art does not a movie 
make. I can a movie idea sell but how many concepts out there never 
translated well to the silver screen?

If you said "Lots and lots of them," go get yourself a cookie! You deserve 
it!﻿
